title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 352.2 - Objective
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 352.2 - Objective

State Regulations

This rule supports the role of probation in assisting
probationers make positive behavioral change through the use of graduated
responses, including incentives and sanctions. It incentivizes pro-social
behavior and promotes public safety and offender accountability through prompt
and decisive action. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
352.2

Amended

New

York State Register March 27, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 13, eff. 3/27/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
